original_table_html:
Figure 7.4 Possible value propositions
Price
More The same Less
Benefits
More More for more More for the same More for less
The same (red cell) (yellow cell) The same for less
Less (red cell) (red cell) Less for much less
summary_markdown: Figure 7.4 outlines possible value propositions by cross-referencing the level of benefits offered against the price charged. The structure is a 3x3 matrix, with "Benefits" on one axis (More, The same, Less) and "Price" on the other (More, The same, Less). Each cell represents a distinct value proposition. "More for more" signifies higher benefits at a higher price. "More for the same" offers increased benefits at a comparable price. "More for less" provides greater benefits for a lower price. "The same for less" delivers equivalent benefits at a reduced price, and "Less for much less" offers reduced benefits at a significantly lower price. Some cells are marked in red, indicating potentially unsustainable or undesirable propositions, while others are yellow, suggesting a less optimal but potentially viable position. The overall framework illustrates how companies can position their offerings based on the interplay of perceived benefits and price points.
